facts.text: Civil Appeal No. 513 of 1958 was filed.

anchor.surface_text: CIVIL APPELLATE JURISDICTION Civil Appeal No. 513 of 1958. Appeal by special leave from the judgment

facts.text: Appeal by special leave from judgment and order dated November 20, 1957 of Bombay High Court in First Appeal No. 600 of 1956.

anchor.surface_text: Appeal by special leave from the judgment and order dated November 20, 1957, of the Bombay High Court in First Appeal No. 600 of 1956, arising out of the judgment and order dated October 17, 1956, of the District Judge, Poona, in Misc. Petition No. 2 of 1956.

facts.text: Judgment and order dated October 17, 1956 of District Judge, Poona in Misc. Petition No. 2 of 1956.

anchor.surface_text: arising out of the judgment and order dated October 17, 1956, of the District Judge, Poona, in Misc. Petition No. 2 of 1956. D. Banaji, S. N. Andley, J. B. Dadachanji, Rameshwar Nath and P. L. Vohra, for the appellant.

facts.text: Judgment delivered on February 22, 1960 by SARKAR, J.

anchor.surface_text: 1960. February, 22. The Judgment of the Court was delivered by SARKAR, J.-Respondents Nos. I to 4 are shareholders in the companypany which is the appellant in this case.

facts.text: Respondents Nos. 1 to 4 are shareholders in the company which is the appellant.

anchor.surface_text: Respondents Nos. I to 4 are shareholders in the companypany which is the appellant in this case. They made an application against the appellant and its directors under s. 153-C of the Companies Act, 1913 before that Act was repealed on April 1, 1956, as hereinafter mentioned, for certain reliefs which it is number necessary to state.

facts.text: Shareholders made application against appellant and its directors under s. 153-C of Companies Act, 1913 before repeal on April 1, 1956.

anchor.surface_text: They made an application against the appellant and its directors under s. 153-C of the Companies Act, 1913 before that Act was repealed on April 1, 1956, as hereinafter mentioned, for certain reliefs which it is number necessary to state. This Act will be referred to as the Act of 1913.

facts.text: Application made to Court of District Judge of Poona, empowered by notification under s. 31 of Act of 1913 by Government of Bombay.

anchor.surface_text: This application had been made to the Court of the District Judge of Poona which Court had been empowered to exercise jurisdiction under the Act of 1913 by a numberification issued by the Government of Bombay under s. 3 1  of that Act.

facts.text: Companies Act, 1913 repealed on April 1, 1956 and re-enacted by Companies Act, 1956.

anchor.surface_text: Before the application companyld be disposed of by the District Judge, Poona, the Act of 1913 was repealed and re-enacted on April 1, 1956, by the Companies Act of 1956, which will be referred to as the Act of 1956.

facts.text: Appellant made application on or about June 28, 1956 to District Judge Poona for dismissal of s.153C application on ground of loss of jurisdiction due to repeal.

anchor.surface_text: On or about June 28, 1956, the appellant made an application to the District Judge of Poona for an order dismissing the application under s. 153-C of the Act of 1913 on the ground that on the repeal of that Act the Court had ceased to have jurisdiction to deal with it.

facts.text: District Judge of Poona dismissed the appellant's application.

anchor.surface_text: The District Judge of Poona dismissed this application. The appellants appeal to the High Court of Bombay against this dismissal also failed.

facts.text: Appellant's appeal to Bombay High Court against dismissal failed.

anchor.surface_text: The District Judge of Poona dismissed this application. The appellants appeal to the High Court of Bombay against this dismissal also failed. Hence the present appeal.

facts.text: Section 644 of Act of 1956 repeals Act of 1913.

anchor.surface_text: Section 644 of the Act of 1956 repeals the Act of 1913 and certain other legislation relating to companypanies.

facts.text: Sections 645 to 657 of Act of 1956 contain saving provisions.

anchor.surface_text: Sections 645 to 657 of the Act of 1956 companytain various saving provisions.

facts.text: Appellant contended that proceeding under s.153C not saved by ss.645-657.

anchor.surface_text: Mr. Banaji appearing for the appellant companytended that the proceeding before the District Judge of Poona under s. 153-C of the Act of 1913 had number been saved by any of these provisions.

facts.text: Paid up capital of appellant more than Rs. 1,00,000.

anchor.surface_text: It has also to be stated that the paid up capital of the appellant is more than Rs. 1,00,000 and the application under s. 153-C of the Act of 1913 companytained a prayer in the alternative for the winding up of the appellant.

facts.text: Application under s.153C contained prayer in alternative for winding up of appellant.

anchor.surface_text: It has also to be stated that the paid up capital of the appellant is more than Rs. 1,00,000 and the application under s. 153-C of the Act of 1913 companytained a prayer in the alternative for the winding up of the appellant.

facts.text: Parties agreed that provisions of s.153C of 1913 Act substantially re-enacted in Act of 1956.

anchor.surface_text: On the other hand, the parties are agreed that the provisions of s. 153-C of the Act of 1913 have been substantially re-enacted by the Act of 1956 and this would indicate an intention number to destroy the rights created by s. 153-C.

facts.text: Sections 397 to 407 of Act of 1956 contain substantially provisions of s.153C of 1913 Act.

anchor.surface_text: Sections 397 to 407 of the Act of 1956, it is agreed, companytain substantially the provis- sions of s. 153-C of the Act of 1913.

facts.text: No dispute that s.153C of 1913 Act gave rights to shareholders and liabilities to company, directors, managing agents.

issues.text: Whether the proceeding before the District Judge of Poona under s. 153-C of the Act of 1913 can be continued in spite of the repeal of the Act of 1913 in view of s. 6 of the General Clauses Act

anchor.surface_text: Mr. Banaji appearing for the appellant contended that the proceeding before the District Judge of Poona under s. 153-C of the Act of 1913 had not been saved by any of these provisions. We do not consider it necessary to pronounce on this question for it seems to us clear that that proceeding can be continued in spite of the repeal of the Act of 1913 in view of s. 6 of the General Clauses Act.

issues.text: Whether the Act of 1956 indicates that it was intended thereby to destroy the rights created by s. 153-C of the Act of 1913

anchor.surface_text: The question then is whether the Act of 1956 indicates that it was intended thereby to destroy the rights created by s. 153-C of the Act of 1913. Mr. Banaji said that s. 647 of the Act of 1956 indicates an intention to destroy the rights created by s. 153-C of the Act of 1913.

issues.text: Whether, in view of s. 10 of the Act of 1956 and s. 24 of the General Clauses Act, the notification empowering the District Judge of Poona ceased to have effect after repeal of the Act of 1913 thereby depriving the court of jurisdiction

anchor.surface_text: Mr. Banaji points out that in view of s. 10 of the Act of 1956 a District Court can no longer be empowered to deal with an application of the kind made to the District Judge of Poona, as that application asks for reliefs similar to those contemplated by ss. 397 to 407 of the Act of 1956 and also asks for the winding up of a company whose paid up capital exceeds Rs. 1,00,000 and power to deal with such an application cannot now be given to a District Court.

issues.text: Whether the District Judge of Poona continues to have jurisdiction to entertain the application under s. 153-C of the Act of 1913 after repeal

anchor.surface_text: It seems to us that since under s. 6 of the General Clauses Act the proceeding in respect of the application under s. 153-C of the Act of 1913 may be continued after the repeal of that Act, it follows that the District Judge of Poona continues to have jurisdiction to entertain it.
